channel.title: BBC News - Business
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Portugal changes vaccine rules for UK visitors
item.description: UK visitors no longer need to quarantine for 14 days if they can't prove they are fully vaccinated.

item.title: Wetherspoons runs low on beer amid driver shortage
item.description: The pub chain and a Coca-Cola bottler are among firms affected by a shortage of UK lorry drivers.

item.title: Amazon to recruit 55,000 staff for expansion drive
item.description: About 2,500 jobs will be created in the UK, with another 40,000 in the US.

item.title: New eco-petrol baffles a quarter of motorists
item.description: E10 is set to become the new standard petrol, but 24% of drivers are unaware of it, says the RAC.

item.title: JoJo Maman Bebe hikes prices for first time in 5 years
item.description: The baby goods retailer tells the BBC that it has raised prices for the first time in five years.

item.title: UK house price rises accelerate, says Nationwide
item.description: Property prices are 13% higher than at the start of the pandemic, the building society says.

item.title: Vauxhall Motors warns chip shortage to last months
item.description: Vauxhall's boss said the global shortage of computer chips is still having a significant impact.

item.title: Transfer deadline day: Premier League spending tops £1bn but is down on previous year
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo's move back to Manchester United on transfer deadline day helps to push Premier League clubs' spending past £1bn - but overall outlay has dropped.

item.title: Covid: Sri Lanka in economic emergency as food prices soar
item.description: The government says it will seize food stocks and set prices to contain inflation.

item.title: India Covid: Economy sees record growth during deadly wave
item.description: The country suffered a devastating Covid spike in April and May but looser pandemic curbs still drove growth.

item.title: Left-wing Democrats want Fed chief replaced
item.description: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and other progressives criticise the central bank chief's record on climate change.

item.title: NHS blood tube shortage: Supplier ramps up imports
item.description: Becton Dickinson has announced it will deliver 9 million blood test tubes to the NHS this week.

item.title: CEO Secrets: 'I was making money, but had no money'
item.description: Honey boss Scott Davies says cash flow problems meant though he was profitable he "had no money".

item.title: Can apps move the #MeToo movement forward?
item.description: Reporting sexual harassment at work is getting easier thanks to new technologies.

item.title: Japan's huge army of under-employed ex-housewives
item.description: Why women are still battling for better jobs in the world's third largest economy.

item.title: The pubs and restaurants counting on Christmas cheer
item.description: In a bid to rebound from Covid plans for this year's festive season are under way.

item.title: CEO Secrets: 'Tear up the business plan'
item.description: CEO Secrets: Brooklyn Brewery boss Eric Ottaway says - be ready to ditch your business plan.

item.title: Can the US crack down on fake vaccination cards?
item.description: As more people are asked to prove vaccination status, a black market in fake health cards has boomed.
